alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Pottawattamie (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 30 at 4:50PM CDT until July 30 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Pottawattamie County in southwestern Iowa... South central Harrison County in southwestern Iowa... Southeastern Washington County in east central Nebraska... * Until 515 PM CDT. * At 450 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles south of Missouri Valley, or 10 miles east of Blair, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * Locations impacted include... Northeastern Council Bluffs, Missouri Valley, Treynor, Underwood, Crescent, Council Bluffs Airport, McClelland, Desoto Bend National Wildlife Refuge, Weston, Hitchcock Nature Center, and Wilson Island State Park. People attending Westfair Amphitheater & Fairgrounds should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 61 and 77. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 8 and 20. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
